snippet.title: Incredibly Unique Gifts at the Intersection of Health and Technology
snippet.description: What do you get for the health-conscious, tech savvy person who “has everything”? They use smart phones to track every step taken and every calorie burned, map their genetic history to predict every possible ailment, and are almost impossible to shop for. In the quest for holiday gift ideas, we traveled to the intersection of heath and [...] read »

snippet.title: How To Be More Productive And Happier During Times Of Stress
snippet.description: The holidays can be a stressful time, with end-of-year goals coming due at work amidst holiday events. But you can make stress work for you. Here's how. read »

snippet.title: How To Share A Work Space
snippet.description: When I started at Forbes, the bosses put me in a big, roomy office. With two other reporters. I liked them both, but the arrangement wreaked havoc on my work. I’d be concentrating on the legal brief I was reading, just about to figure out the nut of the case, [...]

snippet.title: A Headset Actually Made To Be Heard
snippet.description: Headsets for mobile phones rarely sound very good. A new unit from Shure aims to fix that. read »

snippet.title: Getting There: In Which Our Reporter Flies to the American West, Is Captivated by the View
snippet.description: My ungodly departure hour has come and gone, and now I'm off, writing this as my plane cruises over Toledo, Ohio. I'm on my way to Supai, Arizona, a tiny town on the Havasupai Indian Reservation where I'll try to find both glorious seclusion and the most comfort possible with [...] read »
